meanings.definition: To impose or place a burden or duty on someone
meanings.sent1: The teacher will impone a homework assignment on the students.
meanings.sent2: The government may impone taxes on its citizens to fund public services.
meanings.sent3: It would impone quite a challenge on him to carry all those heavy books.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility impone on her shoulders like a heavy cloak.
meanings.sent5: The task of caring for a newborn can impone a sense of overwhelming responsibility.

meanings.definition: To lay or place something on top of something else
meanings.sent1: She will impone the blanket over the sleeping child.
meanings.sent2: Please impone the lid on the jar to keep the food fresh.
meanings.sent3: He decided to impone the hat on the statue for a humorous touch.
meanings.sent4: The clouds impone a veil over the moon, hiding its glow.
meanings.sent5: The chef will impone a garnish on top of the dish to enhance its presentation.

meanings.definition: To enforce or establish a rule or regulation
meanings.sent1: The principal will impone a new dress code for the students.
meanings.sent2: The company may impone strict safety measures in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The idea to impone a 'no talking' rule during the movie was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The judge will impone a sentence on the defendant for their actions.
meanings.sent5: The referee will impone the rules of the game to ensure fair play.
